comments:
CDT 2.0.0.200406250301
on Eclipse RC3
on Linux RedHat EL3

1. Import a large project.
In my case CppTargetRTS contains:
1505 .cc files
381  .h files

2. Build the project (in the foreground).
During the build, an error dialog "Errors Running Operation" appears:
an internal error occurred during Binary Search Thread. (See attached.)

(You cannot close the dialog without moving the build to the background.
Once you do that you can close the dialog and get on with your day.)

The build is successful (and long), but the Binaries are not found.

The following appears in the .log file:

!ENTRY org.eclipse.core.runtime 4 2 Jun 25, 2004 14:51:51.661
!MESSAGE An internal error occurred during: "Binary Search Thread".
!STACK 0
java.lang.NullPointerException
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.CElementDelta.getAncestors
(CElementDelta.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.CElementDelta.createDeltaTree
(CElementDelta.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.CElementDelta.insertDeltaTree
(CElementDelta.java(Inlined Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.CElementDelta.added
(CElementDelta.java(Compiled Code))
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.BinaryRunner.fireEvents
(BinaryRunner.java:94)
        at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.model.BinaryRunner$1.run
(BinaryRunner.java:53)
        at org.eclipse.core.internal.jobs.Worker.run(Worker.java:66)

Created an attachment (id=12840)
Dialog pops up during build

I'll look into this to see if its an easy fix.  
It definitely looks gating.

My initial investigation on SuSE using the latest TargetRTS from /disk6 does not 
yield this problem.  I built the REDHAT80T.x86-gnu3.2 target w/my binary parser 
set to GNU ELF and everything works fine. (I had a breakpoint set on NPE, and it 
was not encountered).

Brent,
  there is a miniscule window for a race condition, and it
__might__ be related to what you are seing..
So I've put a fix in the head for this.

Please give it another spin and let me know.

JC you can forward me this one if your busy
PR was targeted to the 2.0 release but not resolved, moving target to 2.1

I'm getting kind of the same error.
Only I get the "NegativeArraySizeException"
when importing a large CDT project as 4526 files, 848 folders.
Using WinXp and Eclipse 3.0 Finale with CDT 2.0 Finale.
This project I'm importing has 52 exe files and 55 dll files.
Removing the exe files and do the import again fixes the error.
Here's the error. (dunno maybe i should call in a new bug report)
